org.kocakosm.pitaya.charset

Class ASCII

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kocakosm.pitaya.charset.ASCII

  • public final class ASCII
extends Object
    Static utility methods that operate on or return ASCII chars and Strings.
    Author:
    Osman KOCAK

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean canDecode(byte... input)
      Returns whether the given byte array represents valid ASCII encoded characters.
      static boolean canDecode(byte[] input, int off, int len)
      Returns whether the specified range in the given byte array represents valid ASCII encoded characters.
      static boolean canEncode(String str)
      Returns whether the given String can be encoded into ASCII.

      Returns whether the specified range in the given String can be encoded into ASCII.
      static String capitalize(String str)
      Returns a String built from the given one by upper-casing its first character (other characters are copied unchanged).

    • Method Detail

      • canEncode

        public static boolean canEncode(String str)
        Returns whether the given String can be encoded into ASCII.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to test.
        Returns:
        whether str can be encoded into ASCII.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • canEncode

        public static boolean canEncode(String str,
                                int off,
                                int len)
        Returns whether the specified range in the given String can be encoded into ASCII.
        Parameters:
        str - the input String.
        off - the start index, inclusive.
        len - the number of characters to test.
        Returns:
        whether the specified range in str can be encoded into ASCII.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off or len is negative or if off + len is greater than str's length.

      • canDecode

        public static boolean canDecode(byte... input)
        Returns whether the given byte array represents valid ASCII encoded characters.
        Parameters:
        input - the bytes to test.
        Returns:
        whether input repesents ASCII encoded characters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if input is null.

      • canDecode

        public static boolean canDecode(byte[] input,
                                int off,
                                int len)
        Returns whether the specified range in the given byte array represents valid ASCII encoded characters.
        Parameters:
        input - the input buffer.
        off - the start index, inclusive.
        len - the number of bytes to test.
        Returns:
        whether the specified range in input represents ASCII encoded characters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if input is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off or len is negative or if off + len is greater than input's length.

      • encode

        public static byte[] encode(String str)
        Returns the ASCII encoding of the given String.
        Parameters:
        str - the String to encode.
        Returns:
        the ASCII encoding of the given String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if str can't be encoded into ASCII.

      • encode

        public static byte[] encode(String str,
                            int off,
                            int len)
        Returns the ASCII encoding of the specified character sequence.
        Parameters:
        str - the input String.
        off - the start index, inclusive.
        len - the number of characters to encode.
        Returns:
        the ASCII encoding of the specified characters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off or len is negative or if off + len is greater than str's length.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified characters can't be encoded into ASCII.

      • decode

        public static String decode(byte... input)
        Decodes the given ASCII encoded characters.
        Parameters:
        input - the ASCII encoded characters to decode.
        Returns:
        the decoded characters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if input is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if input doesn't represent valid ASCII encoded characters.

      • decode

        public static String decode(byte[] input,
                            int off,
                            int len)
        Decodes len ASCII encoded bytes from the given input buffer, starting at off.
        Parameters:
        input - the input buffer.
        off - the starting offset.
        len - the number of bytes to decode.
        Returns:
        the decoded characters.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if input is null.
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if off or len is negative or if off + len is greater than input's length.
        IllegalArgumentException - if the specified bytes do not represent valid ASCII encoded characters.

      • isPrintable

        public static boolean isPrintable(char c)
        Returns whether the given character is one of the 95 printable ASCII characters.
        Parameters:
        c - the character to test.
        Returns:
        whether the given character is printable.
        Since:
        0.2

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • isLowerCase

        public static boolean isLowerCase(char c)
        Returns whether the given character is one of the lowercase ASCII characters between 'a' and 'z' (inclusive). All others return false.
        Parameters:
        c - the character to test.
        Returns:
        whether the given character is a lowercase character.

      • isUpperCase

        public static boolean isUpperCase(char c)
        Returns whether the given character is one of the uppercase ASCII characters between 'A' and 'Z' (inclusive). All others return false.
        Parameters:
        c - the character to test.
        Returns:
        whether the given character is a uppercase character.

      • toLowerCase

        public static char toLowerCase(char c)
        Returns the lowercase equivalent of the given character. If the given character doesn't represent an uppercase ASCII character, this method simply returns the given argument.
        Parameters:
        c - the character to transform lowercase.
        Returns:
        the lowercase equivalent of the given character if it is an uppercase one, or the argument itself otherwise.

      • toUpperCase

        public static char toUpperCase(char c)
        Returns the uppercase equivalent of the given character. If the given character doesn't represent a lowercase ASCII character, this method simply returns the given argument.
        Parameters:
        c - the character to transform uppercase.
        Returns:
        the uppercase equivalent of the given character if it is a lowercase one, or the argument itself otherwise.

      • toLowerCase

        public static String toLowerCase(String str)
        Returns a String in which all uppercase ASCII characters have been replaced by their lowercase equivalent (all other characters are unchanged).
        Parameters:
        str - the String to convert into lowercase.
        Returns:
        the converted String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • toUpperCase

        public static String toUpperCase(String str)
        Returns a String in which all lowercase ASCII characters have been replaced by their uppercase equivalent (all other characters are unchanged).
        Parameters:
        str - the String to convert into uppercase.
        Returns:
        the converted String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.

      • capitalize

        public static String capitalize(String str)
        Returns a String built from the given one by upper-casing its first character (other characters are copied unchanged).
        Parameters:
        str - the String to capitalize.
        Returns:
        the capitalized String.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if str is null.
